column3: near the center of Monroe County. The Unicoi Mountains rise prominently to the southeast.

column1: The City of Madisonville originally began as the town of Tellico
column2: and prior to that a Cherokee village of the same name. The Calhoun Treaty and resulting Hiwassee Purchase of 1819 opened the area for white settlement. Madisonville was founded in the early 1820s as a county seat for Monroe County
column3: which had been formed in 1819.  The town was initially known as "Tellico
column4: but its name was changed to Madisonville" in 1830 in honor of U.S. President James Madison in accordance with a petition from the residents presented by state representative James Madison Greenway. Madisonville was incorporated on May 16

column1: The Monroe County Airport is a county-owned
column2: public-use airport located two nautical miles (3.7 km) northwest of the central business district of Madisonville.

column1: Madisonville is also home to a satellite campus of Cleveland State Community College.
The Monroe County Schools System serves Madisonville
Sequoyah High School.Sequoyah was formed by the consolidation of Vonore High School and Madisonville High School in 1995.
